item.title: Summer camp
item.description: Join us for summer camps for students 6 to 10 years old from 9 am to 1 pm from July 24th to August 29th, July 31st to August 4th, and August 7th to August 11th! Register By: July 15th, 2023. Capacity: 6 students. Cost: $300 per student.

item.title: Summer Break
item.description: Blue Ridge Boost will be closed from June 5th to July 23th. However, online classes are available in June and July! The regular schedule resumes on July 24th.

item.title: Free trial coding classes
item.description: Open house every Sunday at 1pm! Come in to see the space and meet the instructor! Bring in your child for demo sessions.

item.title: New Location in Downtown Charlottesville
item.description: The new office is ready for students!

item.title: New Location in Downtown Charlottesville
item.description: Starting in September, Blue Ridge Boost is located at 222 Court Square, Charlottesville. To reach us, please walk around to the back of the building. Walk up the stairs to the secong floor and enter through the door on your left. The closest paid parking is the Market Street Garage. Free 2-hour parking is available throughout the Downtown area.

item.title: Fall Classes
item.description: Fall classes coming soon!

item.title: Algebra 2 Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Algebra 2 Tutoring in Charlottesville We help your child succeed in algebra and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include a Algebra 1 review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Algebra 2! Join our summer classes in August, to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review Algebra 1, including linear functions, linear equations and systems of equations, exponent laws, quadratic functions, and polynomials.

item.title: Algebra Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Algebra 1 Tutoring in Charlottesville We help your child succeed in algebra and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include a prealgebra review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Algebra 1! Join our summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review pre-algebra, including fractions, ratios, proportions, order of operations, and exponents.

item.title: AMC and MathCounts Coaching in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: AMC Coach and Tutor in Charlottesville An experienced instructor with MathCounts and AMC8 coaching experience teaches mini-lessons on topics commonly found in competition math problems and leads students in solving practice problems. The content of the class depends on the target competition and the student’s background. Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us for further information.

item.title: Authors | Blue Ridge Boost
Block Language Classes for Six to Ten-Year-Olds | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Block Language Coding for Children Students ages six to ten learn fundamental coding concepts by helping a beaver build a dam on instructor-provided Chromebooks. First, students learn to code using simple commands to move left, right and drop logs. Next, students learn to code repetition using repeat loops executed a fixed or a variable number of times. In the second part of the course, students learn to code using conditional loops.

item.title: Coding Classes in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Ongoing Coding Classes in Charlottesville Kindergarten to Second Grade Block Coding Times by request Scratch Sundays, 1:00 – 1:50 pm Sundays, 2:00 – 2:50 pm Third to Fifth Grade Coffee Script Sundays, 11:00 – 11:50 am Sundays, 3:30 – 4:30 pm Other times by request Sixth to Eight Grade Python Saturdays, 2:30 – 3:20 pm Sundays, 12:00 — 12:50 pm Other times by request Four coding classes for only $95!

item.title: Coding Group Classes for 4 to 6 year olds | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Coding Group Classes for Early Coders Our youngest students learn fundamental coding concepts by helping a monkey collect bananas on instructor-provided Chromebooks. Students learn the basics of coding using left, right, jump up, jump left, and jump right commands to guide a monkey to collect all bananas before opening a treasure chest. In addition, students learn to code repetition by using loops and conditional loops. The course concludes with procedures.

item.title: Competition Math for Elementary and Middle School | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Math Olympiad Coach and Tutor in Charlottesville An experienced instructor teaches mini-lessons on topics commonly found in Math Olympiad contests and leads students in solving practice problems. The content of the class depends on the target competition and the student’s background. Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us for further information.

item.title: Computer Science Tutor | Blue Ridge Boost
Contact | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us for any learning needs in math and computing. We offer online and in-person one-on-one instruction and in-person group classes for students from middle school to graduate student level in Mathematics and Computer Science.

item.title: Geometry Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Geometry Tutoring in Charlottesville We help your child succeed in algebra and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include algebra and middle school geometry review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Geometry Join our Summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review Algebra 1 topics, including linear equations, systems of linear equations, and the Pythagorean Theorem.

item.title: Individualized Math Tutoring | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Math Classes and Tutoring in Charlottesville Elementary Elementary Math Math Olympiad Coaching Middle School Middle School Math Algebra 1 Geometry AMC 8/10/12 Coaching High School Algebra 2 Pre-calculus AP Calculus AB/BC AP Statistics College Calculus Abstract Algebra Real Analysis General Topology

item.title: Kids Classes in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Coding Group Classes for Tweens (ages 8 to 12) in Charlottesville Students learn fundamental coding concepts using Coffee Script, a beginner-friendly text-based coding language. The young coders use an attractive graphical interface to generate text by pressing buttons on instructor-provided Chromebooks. Some previous experience typing is helpful but not necessary. Classes run in four-week sessions. Each class is 50 minutes long. We adjust classes to the pace of each student.

item.title: Lego Robotics for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Build Lego Robots and Code with WeDo 2.0 Come and learn to build and program Lego robots! In each lesson, students build a Lego robot using a design model, improve and extend it, and then create a program using Scratch to control and move the robot. The robots use a medium power motor to act, depth, and tilt sensor to sense. A Scratch program encodes the robot’s actions in response to sensing.

item.title: Lego Spike Robotics for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Build Lego Robots and Code with Lego Spike Come and learn to build and program Lego robots! Students learn to build robot attachments and code the Spike robot using Scratch.

item.title: Math and Coding Camps in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Morning Camp Ages 6 to 10: Come to learn to code using Scratch or Coffee Script, build Lego robots and solve math puzzles! The activities do not repeat; students may join us for one, two, or all three weeks! Session 1: 9 am to 1 pm, July 24th to July 28th Session 2: 9 am to 1 pm, July 31st to August 4th Session 3: 9 am to 1 pm, August 7th to August 11th

item.title: Math Tutoring for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Private Math Tutor in Charlottesville At Blue Ridge Boost, we teach problem-solving skills using a variety of math manipulatives, Montessori materials, and math games. In addition, we use a variety of curricula based on the Virginia Standards of Learning, Common Core, Singapore Math, and Beast Academy. Experienced instructors are ready to help your child develop a good understanding of the content, whether to keep up with classwork or expand knowledge beyond the school curriculum.

item.title: Math Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
Middle School Math Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Middle School Math Tutoring in Charlottesville We help your child succeed in math and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. At Blue Ridge Boost, a qualified and experienced teacher assesses your student’s knowledge and builds an individualized instruction plan that targets weak areas while assisting with topics the student is learning. Supplementing Classroom Instruction The instructor will work with the classroom teacher when available to match the teaching style and materials to maintain consistency in the presentation style.

item.title: Precalc Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Precalculus Tutoring in Charlottesville We help your child succeed in precalculus and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include an Algebra 2 review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Math Analysis/Precalc! Join our summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review Algebra 2 and Trigonometry, including quadratic, exponential, polynomial, and trigonometric functions.

item.title: Python Classes in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Python Classess and Tutoring in Charlottesville Are you a middle schooler interested in Python? Come and learn with us! Students learn Python using a combination of lessons that use the Code Monkey platform and Jupyter Notebooks created by the instructor. Classes run in four-week sessions. Each class is 50 minutes long. We adjust classes to the pace of each student. Students typically need between ten to fourteen sessions to complete the course, depending on age and previous coding experience.

item.title: Scratch Coding for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Scratch Coding and Tutoring in Charllottesville Learn Scratch with us! We teach Scratch using a project-based approach. You will learn to create games, including Make it Fly!, Dungeons, Pong, Dodge the Balls, Jumping game, Math facts practice, a clone of Crossy Road, and much more. Contact us to join an ongoing class or for private tutoring!

item.title: USA Computing Olympiad Coaching | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: USA Computing Olympiad Coach and Tutor in Charlottesville Contact us to get coaching for USA Computing Olympiad!

item.title: Vision and History | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: History of Blue Ridge Boost During the COVID-19 pandemic, I spent significant time teaching and helping my children learn and discovered that I greatly enjoy teaching young students. As a result, I quit my Ph.D. program in Computer Science to pursue a degree in teaching at the University of Virginia, which I completed in May 2022. During the lockdown, my children tried a variety of challenging and exciting classes. Still, however good the instructors were, they could not compensate for the lack of face-to-face interaction.

item.title: Your Instructor: Nora Evans | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Math Experience Master of Science - Mathematics from the University of Virginia Master of Teaching - Mathematics Algebra teacher at Peabody School AMC8 and MathCounts coach AP Summer Institute training in AP Calculus AB/BC Calculus and Abstract Algebra in-person tutoring for over a year internship at Monticello High School in Algebra 2, Precalculus, and Geometry co-founder and organizer of Cville Math Circle for preschool and elementary school-age girls teaching assistant for graduate-level courses Financial Mathematics instructor at the University of Virginia Computer Science and Coding Experience Master in Computer Science co-author of several research articles several years of industry experience over a year of online tutoring on Wyzant in C, C++, Java, Python, List, and Prolog.
